meanings.definition: Having skin that is red and painful from the sun's rays.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at the beach, my sunburned shoulders were very sore.
meanings.sent2: She applied aloe vera to her sunburned skin to soothe the pain.
meanings.sent3: Despite wearing sunscreen, I still ended up sunburned like a lobster.
meanings.sent4: The sunburned landscape looked as if it had been painted with fiery colors.
meanings.sent5: The image of his sunburned face stayed with me long after our trip.

meanings.definition: To become sunburned from exposure to the sun.
meanings.sent1: I always forget to reapply sunscreen and end up sunburned every summer.
meanings.sent2: She sunburned easily and had to be careful when spending time outdoors.
meanings.sent3: He managed to sunburned his back even though he thought he had covered every spot.
meanings.sent4: The tourists were warned not to sunburned during the peak hours of sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The children were scolded for getting sunburned after playing outside all day.
